article.headline: Rutgers 72, Miami 70 (OT)
article.story: PISCATAWAY, N.J. (AP)-- Ricky Shields scored 19 points and hit the decisive free throws with 15 seconds left as Rutgers defeated Miami 72-70 on Wednesday night. Rutgers (13-6, 5-4 Big East) won its fourth straight game while sending Miami (13-9, 3-5) to its fourth straight loss and its second straight in overtime. The Hurricanes are 0-3 in overtime this year while Rutgers is 2-0. Rutgers' Quincy Douby forced overtime with a left-wing jumper with 9.5 seconds left, tying it at 59-59. With the score tied at 61 in overtime, Douby hit a 3-pointer with one second on the shot clock to give Rutgers a lead it would not relinquish. Douby added two foul shots and Marquis Webb made one of two free throws to give Rutgers a 67-61 lead. Miami cut it to 69-67 with 16.5 seconds left and then fouled Shields on the inbounds with 15.0 remaining; Shields made both free throws. After Darius Rice missed a 3-pointer, Miami kept possession and after a time-out, Guillermo Diaz hit a three to make it 71-70 with 1.4 seconds left. Miami could not get a clean inbounds pass, giving Rutgers its 10th win in 11 home games and the first-four game Big East winning streak in school history.
